name: John Smith
bio: John Smith is a classically trained chef who specializes in French cuisine. She graduated from Le Cordon Bleu Paris and honed her skills working in Michelin-starred restaurants in Paris and Lyon. After moving to New York, Samantha became the executive chef at a popular French bistro, where she earned rave reviews for her traditional dishes with a modern twist. She is known for her attention to detail and her use of seasonal and local ingredients. In addition to running her own catering business, Samantha is also a culinary instructor and frequently appears as a guest chef on local television shows.

recipeInfo.ingredients: linguine, shrimp, peeled and deveined, garlic, minced butter,white wine.
recipeInfo.cooking_method: Cook linguine according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and sauté for 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 3-4 minutes. Add white wine and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Add cooked linguine to the skillet and toss to coat with sauce. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped parsley and lemon slices. Serve immediately.
